basics.name: Batul Kanawati
basics.label: Front-End Developer | Angular | TypeScript
basics.summary: Experienced Front-End developer specialized in JavaScript with over two years of hands-on experience building performant and user-friendly web applications. A day in my life my consist of: prepping web art, fixing front-end bugs, adding an API endpoint, querying data, configuring UI testing, or working on a new feature if lucky. I am always looking for an exciting opportunity where I can apply my expertise, learn and evolve.

work.name: Majid Al Futtaim
work.description: Majid Al Futtaim is the leading shopping mall, communities, retail and leisure pioneer across the Middle East, Africa and Asia.
work.summary: Working as part of the core team to build MAF Payments, a Payment Gateway, that processes and settle payments from customers to merchants
highlights: Worked on the development of an Angular based PG (payment gateway) portal that supports merchants and other internal users.
Contributed in updating and migrating beam app components, a digital wallet application, and ensuring a smooth sunset plan.
Created MAF Payment Gateway Components, UI components built to allow merchants to accept payments by integrating with the MAF payment API in the Javascript Framework of their choice.
Worked with fellow backend developers. Helped structure API's, include external API paths to the Serverless API Gateway and wrote database queries.
Collaborated and engaged in development conversations with other fellow developers for better results and to build inclusive relationships.

work.name: Quilt
work.description: A platform built to help women connect.
work.summary: Worked on the development of Quilt website
highlights: Convert and migrate Quilt old platform current frontend using primarily HTML/CSS/JS.
Build discount code into cart to reduce the total invoice price before sending it to Stripe, using a combo of JS, GraphQL & Ruby.

work.name: Tapered.js
work.summary: Contributed to tapered-js development. This project was created using Babel and Webpack to generate Tape test files from test code written inline in comments.
highlights: Created library comment syntax that abstracts repetitive test code to improve developer workflow for Tape unit testing.
Built Babel plugin with custom parser to transpile Tapered syntax to Tape code.
Customized Uglify functionality to simultaneously remove commented code and populate pre-generated test files with keyed comments.
Designed custom Webpack plugin to handle asynchronous behavior to correctly transpile commented code before test file generation.
Extended plugin behavior with regex search and replace algorithm to convert commented test blocks to executable code.
Provided configurable file name and file path features for Babel plugin to deliver easy test file setup.
Ensured compatibility with popular testing utilities by testing React applications using Enzyme shallow rendering.

projects.name: My Personal JSON Resume
projects.description: This project aims to create my CV using JSON resume and preact. It provides an easy way to manage resume data, styles, and iterations. In fact, this Resume is created using this project.

projects.name: Detailed facial recognition software
projects.description: This project aims to optimize algorithms for facial recognition that mainly focused on defining face data upon comparison with stored image data.
